I wrote a negative review and received an email from the company the same day apologizing that I was unhappy. They offered to fully refund my money or send me a new brush at no charge. I opted to try a new brush and I'm so glad I did! Somehow the first brush I received was faulty, it didn't spread my makeup and after I washed it the bristles didn't dry after two days. But thanks to the amazing customer service of this company, I was able to get a new brush that is absolutely amazing. Buy this brush. You won't regret it!

I've used it about 4 times now and I really love the finish, it's dense and gives great application of the liquid foundation I use.   68. Before reading my review, you will need context: 1. I just received this brush, so my review is based on one day's use. I will have to update this review periodically to detail its durability. 2. I only own one comparable brush. It is an off-brand travel-size flat top kabuki that I bought at Marshalls for 10 dollars (it came with a cheapie beauty blender that I tossed.) That brush is also great, so it confirms my suspicions about well-marketed overpriced brushes. On first impression I am impressed and happy with this brush. It deserves a high rating, but I'm awarding it 4 stars instead of 5 because of one drawback. As others have mentioned, it has a strong chemical smell, which makes me wonder about the way it was manufactured, and how a smell could linger for so long during its shipping process. Also: does its chemical smell indicate toxicity? Is this detrimental to use on my face? These are important questions to ask, and merit further investigation. But for purposes of functionality, I'll put the smell factor on hold and focus on the brush's functionality. This brush is immediately excellent. Though it arrived smelling horribly, after a wash the smell subdued. Pro: The package gives you clear instructions on how to wash the brush. The package is also ziplock like, so you can keep it for travel. (But realistically it's not all that functional if you have a brush collection or makeup bag.) I purchased this brush after doing extensive research for a week on alternatives to the more popular Sigma F80. I had started immersing myself in the makeup world, and all of the Youtube Beauty gurus were recommending the Sigma. However, it's hard for me to trust a group that is paid to hawk products. So I went searching alternative brushes. I also believe, after some research, that many of the branded brushes are manufactured in China or elsewhere by the same companies. So it's possible to find replicate products. They just won't be branded. That's what this brush is to me. A great product that could be on the market with another brand name on the handle. Specs: It is very soft. It applies both my primer and foundation well. Questions I have about it: -How much product gets stuck in the bristles? I once almost purchased the Bare Minerals Perfecting Face Brush, but the sales woman recommended I get a beauty blender instead because the brush is extremely hard to clean. This brush may have similar issues--the foundation may end up getting stuck because the bristles are dense and close together. However they aren't so tightly packed that you can't wash it well. -Will there be fallout? Regrets: None. I am VERY happy with this brush. It it excellent quality for the price I paid (about $7 with a discount code.) If the company just works on the smell, it will have a winning product on its hands.I hella don't need a Sigma now that I've got this thing. Though I would like to try one for comparison purposes, I don't feel I am missing out on quality
  69. Loved the brush! Evenly applies liquid foundation. I will be purchasing a second brush!

  82. I purchased the five set kabuki brush which I'm realizing now was a little overkill (how many kabuki brushes can you have?) but I was highly intrigued by the set and the companies dedication. First impression. The packaging is great. The brushes come individually packaged and the brush holder all come in a box filled with pink confetti and a very cute sticker (that I won't spoil for you:), this would make a perfect gift for any makeup lover. When I opened the bags for each brush they emitted and awful smell. Seriously they smelt awful which was an initial turn off. I immediately washed them my preferred way, with baby shampoo, and the smell was gone. I am still not fan of the idea that the brushes came loaded with chemicals but this is the only con. The brushes are AMAZING. Incredibly dense and full yet incredibly soft and pick up makeup so well. These apply effortlessly and really give your skin an airbrushed look. So easy to use yet so effective. These brushes are far better than Sigma's kabuki though somewhat different, Sigma's have a slightly larger head and are fluffier however these are denser and equally as soft as Sigmas and I find the denseness gives a better application. I won't be using my Sigma again any time soon. These brushes also have a great weight to them. Very heavy duty wood handle with a sturdy metal ferrule, you can tell the quality just by holding them. On top of this Beauty Junkees has some of the best customer service I've ever experienced. When I received the kit the leather tube was too small to hold all the brushes and I was very confused. I contacted the seller who responded right away and said they had made their brushes denser which in return caused them to be larger and they no longer all fit in the tube. She told me they were in the process of making a new larger tube and offered to send me one when they were completed in a few months. Well during this time the seller kept me up to date on the production of their tubes andsure enough I received one via priority mail wrapped in pink tissue paper. This tube is perfect for holding all the brushes and is a beautiful leather and very very solid. Beauty junkees truly cares about their customers satisfaction and was extremely kind and prompt in their response. I have since bought several of their other products because I value their great quality and great customer service. Can't go wrong with this brush or this company.

  117. This product is great. I have had expensive brushes prior to this such as the sigma flat top kabuki brush. This brush is almost an exact dupe and I will say that I actually prefer this one to the sigma brush. The sigma seems a bit more dense then this brush and a touch lighter. I use drugstore and high end products with this brush and they buff out perfectly. I find that it helps to keep in mind when using this brush that there is no need to push the brush on your face and keep a light touch. If you push too hard you lose the flawless look that this product can give you. The brush works if you use a heavier foundation with major coverage or a regular bb cream. Also cleaning this brush is an absolute breeze. With the synthetic bristles it hardly soaks up any product. Plus it's so soft and has absolutely no shedding which is a major deal because who enjoys picking peices of their brush off their face every morning? I would definitely recommend this to a newbie in makeup application and a pro alike.

The foundation still settles in but I blame that on not having a better primer. Anyways, I get amazing coverage and don't have to spend a long time blending and buffing. It also worked well for stippling and it doesn't leave streaks after blending. I'd say overall, great brush for the price! Just a quick tip: apply moisterizer to clean face - wait at least 10 minutes [or even 3 hrs.] Put a few dot of the makeup on strategic places on face and quickly swirl the brush all around your face. The makeup applied this way, will last so-o-o-o long you won't believe it. Thanks Beauty Junkees.

  453. I wrote the following review for the &#34;Flat Top Kabuki Brush&#34; but I also bought the &#34;Concealer Makeup Brush for Eyes&#34;. I wish now that I would have bought the entire set because I love these two so much. All I can tell you is to BUY THEM! They're great brushes and I could not be without them! I LOVE them!<br />********************************************************************************<br /><br />I am in my late 50's and I guess you could say I am a make-up newbie. Well, sort of. I used to wear make-up years ago when I was working every day but I got out of the habit of &#34;making myself up&#34; after retiring early and sort of ... ahem...well, I let myself go.<br /><br />Recently I have begun to see the results of age on my face and have not liked AT ALL what I saw looking back at me in the mirror! Not only wrinkles, which is a whole other story, but my pores seemed to have grown to gargantuan size. I know I had some acne scars from my teenage years but they seemed to have grown much larger with age. So back to the department store makeup counter I went and picked up a bottle of liquid foundation that promised to give me that dewey look of youth. The sales woman told me I absolutely needed to use a foundation brush to apply this new foundation [which she would sell me for $36.00] but I thought it kind of weird to use a brush to put my makeup on and politely declined. [I figured I could just do it the old fashioned way - with my fingers - which cost me nothing.]<br /><br />I thought applying makeup after getting out of the habit for so many years would be like riding a bike. But, truthfully, it just didn't look like it did when I was younger. After viewing some professional online make-up tutorials in which brushes were used, I thought about buying one but frankly the prices seemed so steep, especially since I needed all the other products one needs to keep a face looking beautiful. But once I bought all the basics one needs in the makeup department I kept wondering if I would get better results with a foundation brush. That $40 bottle of foundation was not hiding those acne scars [so much for the &#34;dewey look&#34;, I thought] and I figured I had just wasted my money on a product that did nothing for my face.<br /><br />And then I came across this brush, the Premium Foundation Makeup Brush - Flat Top from Beauty Junkees [LOVE that company name!]. It had stellar reviews and was quite inexpensive so I decided to try it and another brush. [I flip-flopped back and forth about getting the whole set but thought I would just try one or two first. Now I wish I would have purchased the whole set.]<br /><br />I wasn't sure how to use a foundation brush to apply my makeup but after viewing some more online videos I decided just to jump in. After only about 5 minutes of practice I really and truly was blown away at how well those acne scars disappeared using this brush! With a simple &#34;stippling&#34; and twisting motion I was able to magically fill in those acne scars! I then used another brush to apply a light coating of powder and my skin actually looked flawless! I felt like I had lost ten years off my face.<br /><br />The bristles on these brushes are so thick and so soft! The brushes, themselves, are very well constructed For someone who is &#34;new&#34; to applying foundation with brushes I found them very simple to use and with the large, hefty handles, very comfortable to hold and to work with. They clean easily and dry fast. And they work!<br /><br />I am so grateful to have found this foundation brush and at such a reasonable price. I recommend this brush to anyone who wants to get rid of the appearance of acne scars. I never thought that a foundation brush could make such a difference but it truly does. I am simply amazed at how, with the right tools, one can change the face of time. I couldn't be without it now.if I would get better results with a foundation brush. That $40 bottle of foundation was not hiding those acne scars [so much for the &#34;dewey look&#34;, I thought] and I figured I had just wasted my money on a product that did nothing for my face.   508. I use many types of brushes at different price points - from good ol' drugstore Revlon (still going strong after many, many years) to spendy Jane Iredale -- as well as faves priced in the middle (RealTechniques and Japonesque). Almost every brush I have offers value in its own way, as long as I respect just how that particular tool works best.<br /><br />BUT- I'm pickiest about my foundation brush, as this is what &#34;sets the canvas&#34; for everything else. My current foundation brush, wearing out from repeated, almost daily use over 10 years, is Jane Iredale's &#34;The Handi.&#34; Replacing it proves expensive enough that I decided to first shop around --- and man, I'm glad I did!<br /><br />Beauty Junkees' Flat Top Kabuki is hands-down, the best and most versatile brush I have ever used - regardless of price. When I pulled it out of its package, I was blown away because, while hopeful based on other reviews, I was simply not expecting the level of quality.<br /><br />Heft and balance: perfect. The handle is satisfying to hold, with a very substantial brush head so dense, it doesn't splay when you push down hard on it. This is a large brush, but not overly so - I carry it in my makeup bag daily.<br /><br />Feel: no scratching, it's one of the softest brushes I have and feels like teddy bear fur!<br /><br />Shedding: it doesn't. I've used it every day for several weeks and not a hair has come out that I've noticed.<br /><br />Media: works exceptionally for any kind of base (BB cream, creme or lotion foundation - and powdered minerals, which I use most often). Works with setting powders, too.<br /><br />Vegan friendly - yes. All synthetic (surprised me, as I thought I could never give up my squirrel hair brush!)<br /><br />Cleaning: a snap. A dab of olive oil and soap, rinse -- and it literally dries in 2-3 hours! (The brush comes with use and care instructions, too - very handy. I've also used a regular brush cleaner and it works just fine.)<br /><br />Price: insanely low. Meaning every single gal on a budget, can afford to have at least one fantastic make up brush in her arsenal!<br /><br />This kabuki is an incredible value. Don't miss out!nsanely low. Meaning every single gal on a budget, can afford to have at least one fantastic make up brush in her arsenal!<br /><br />This kabuki is an incredible value. Don't miss out!

  541. I'm gonna confess right away that I'm a little (okay, a lot) obsessive when I'm buying products. I research reviews like crazy, and this time I actually bought multiple brands of flat top kabuki's to see which one I liked best. I heard about the Sigma F80 but didn't want to spend that much if I could get something comparable for less. So I ordered an inexpensive kabuki set from Royal Care Cosmetics and this Beauty Junkees flat top. I want to save money, but I don't want cheap quality. Right away I could see that the Beauty Junkees was better quality: heavier, denser bristles, and very soft. I have a food scale for baking, so I set each one on there to check the weight difference. RC Cosmetics 31 grams, Beauty Junkees 44 grams. (Both weighed before use to keep product build up from confusing the weights.)<br /><br />My thought when I applied my foundation with the BJ brush: \\"Where have you been all my life?!\\" I can't believe I've spent years applying foundation by hand. I have tried a traditional foundation brush before, but it was tedious and still streaky. This flat top is like a dream. The foundation goes on so beautifully and the brush feels amazing on the skin. It's also nicely weighted in my hand.<br /><br />The reason I'm taking off one star is that when I washed the brush there was the tiniest bit of looseness in the ferrule. Five stars for customer service, though, because they immediately sent out a second brush. The second brush has a secure ferrule but is slightly less dense than the first. I popped it on the scale and it was 41 grams.<br /><br />I got worried that I was missing out on something special with the Sigma F80, so I ordered it for comparison (I told you I was obsessive). It is the same density as the first Beauty Junkees brush I received but I think the Beauty Junkees wins on softness. There's something about the Beauty Junkees that is more gentle when pressing flat against the skin. The Sigma F80 weighs 39 grams, and my impression is that the handle is lighter than the Beauty Junkees handle, since the F80 bristles are definitely as dense.<br /><br />No shedding from the Beauty Junkees flat top through use and three washes. The Sigma had four little hairs sticking up that would need to be trimmed level. Both Beauty Junkees flat tops had exactly one hair that needs to be trimmed.<br /><br />Verdict: I'm keeping my Beauty Junkees flat top and returning the Sigma and RC Cosmetics brushes. I'm not missing out on anything, since I have a fantastic brush from Beauty Junkees. Beauty Junkees is in between the price of the other two brands, which makes it a perfect choice for quality and price. Because they are more affordable than Sigma but very similar quality, I plan to buy the other Beauty Junkees kabuki brushes as well.handle is lighter than the Beauty Junkees handle, since the F80 bristles are definitely as dense.<br /><br />No shedding from the Beauty Junkees flat top through use and three washes. The Sigma had four little hairs sticking up that would need to be trimmed level. Both Beauty Junkees flat tops had exactly one hair that needs to be trimmed.<br /><br />Verdict: I'm keeping my Beauty Junkees flat top and returning the Sigma and RC Cosmetics brushes. I'm not missing out on anything, since I have a fantastic brush from Beauty Junkees. Beauty Junkees is in between the price of the other two brands, which makes it a perfect choice for quality and price. Because they are more affordable than Sigma but very similar quality, I plan to buy the other Beauty Junkees kabuki brushes as well.

  552. UPDATE!<br />Amazon would not allow me to review different brushes from the same company so they are combined below.<br /><br />Ordered 7/20/15. Review: 3 STARS - Flat Angled Kabuki Brush...<br />I had success with Beauty Junkees Flat Top Brush so I thought it would be nice to have the Angled Brush version as well. Some of the hairs were sticking out oddly but the overall bunch seemed intact well so at least it's usable. Other than looking a bit beat up, it could be a clone for the application of the Flat Top Kabuki Brush, down to the hairs holding makeup in odd places. It's been helpful in contouring and cutting back on cleaning frequency when combined with the Flat Top. Although I admit, I like the Flat Top better.<br /><br />Ordered 6/27/15. Review: 4 STARS - Flat Top Kabuki Brush...<br />I've used this brush only a handful of times but wow! Not only is it less time consuming than a sponge but the application is flawless and non irritating. So far, I've used this with high end mineral foundation, drug-store foundation, tinted sunscreen, AND a creamy highlighter. I wear make up four to five days a week and tinted sunscreen every day. I dot the product I am using directly onto my face with my finger first (literally a few dots onto each area - cheeks, chin, nose, forehead) then use the flat top kabuki to blend. The brush hairs are soft and make blending effortless. The hairs do seem to hold makeup in odd spots (pictured) after using, but it doesn't affect the appearance of the application.<br /><br />The brush arrived promptly thanks to Prime shipping. In my opinion, the size was just right. It has a heftiness that high end brands have. There were a few uneven hairs I had to trim away (pictured) and a couple came out during its first use. Thankfully no others have shed and it's kept its integrity so far after being reused and washed. It is early but I am optimistic that this brush will last a long time. The price is amazing for the quality (so far!) you receive AND if you get your hands on a promotion or coupon, it is hands down THE best choice. When I used the Sigma brush, it was so dense, and the bristles were so thick, that it literally exfoliated my extremely dry skin. (No matter how light of a touch I used, or how much I primed and moisturized, the brush was so dense it would literally cause my skin to start flaking).<br /><br />I was hesitant to purchase this brush, but figured I would try it and see if it was better. I am SO glad I made this decision!<br /><br />The bristles on this brush are MUCH softer than the SIgma F80. This brush doesn't absorb nearly as much product as my sigma flat top, and it isn't too dense so it leaves a flawless, poreless finish WITHOUT exfoliating/drying my skin.<br /><br />I am so so so happy with this purchase, and I am 100% sure that this brush is BETTER than the Sigma F80, not only in quality, but also in price!<br /><br />The only downside was it had a slightly chemical scent, but it went away after washing it once which is what the package suggests.<br /><br />If you have sensitive skin, and are looking for a really great foundation brush without having to spend a lot, this brush is for you. Now I'm going to save up so I can buy some more brushes in this set!
  590. Works flawlessly. A good bush for the price.
  591. LOVE IT! It feels amazing, soft, and high quality for the price.
  592. I got the Kabuki Brush by Beauty Junkees for my wife to try out. Based on her feedback, she found it was different than what she was used to, but it was definitely a high-quality product.<br /><br />She's used to a brush with stiffer bristles, and the white tips of this brush were softer and offered more drag and coverage with the foundation she was using. Once she got used to that difference, she liked the effect and result. There was no bristle shedding, and the handle was comfortable and easy to hold.<br /><br />Overall, she thought the Kabuki brush was a very good brush and much cheaper than what she would expect to pay elsewhere.<br /><br />Disclosure:<br />Obtained From: Retailer<br />Payment: Free
  593. I recently tried BeautyJunkees Kabuki Brush and I have to say I am impressed. The flat top brush has a great feel to the handle and the bristles are dense but oh so soft. The bristles feel great on the skin and disperse powders nicely. I do not use foundation but it seems that the product should smooth on nicely from the look and feel of the brush fibers. Normally, I use Bobbi Brown brushes which do a great job with makeup application but this brush is a serious contender at a fraction of the price. My BB Kabuki brush was around $40 and I have used it for years so it was well worth it. This brush comes in at around a quarter of the price. Time will tell how it holds up.But certainly worth a try considering the price point and quality.<br /><br />The one drawback is the manufacturer recommends you wash the brush every day. Well I am sure that is best but it is not realistic for most. The packaging is simple but nice.<br /><br />The brush is synthetic - vegan friendly which is a consideration. Some other brushes are made of animal hair which does not appeal to everyone. All in all this brush boasts quality bristles, a nice hand grip, easy on the pocketbook price point and it works beautifully. What more could you ask more?

There's very little product left on the brush--the flat top means you just use the tips of the bristles--and I think it was designed for someone who uses makeup as I do.<br /><br />The instructions insist on cleaning the brush after each use. I'm pretty bad about cleaning my makeup brushes, but promise I'll do better. The outstanding communication this company gives its customers recommends cleaning oil based makeup with olive oil, on the theory that oil cleans oil. The makeup sleeves are also wonderful and help keep my brush's shape.<br /><br />Thanks, Beauty Junkees!
  738. I had been wanting to try the Tarte foundation brush similar to this one, but couldn't bring myself to pay the nearly $40. I'm so glad I ran into this brush. The bristles are soft and densely packed making application of liquid makeup fast and easy. I find I need less foundation for the same coverage. I haven't noticed any bristles falling out and the construction seems to be sturdy as well. I often use e.l.f. brushes, but I find that it's not uncommon for the brush to easily fall off the handle after regular use (maybe I'm just too rough). In my opinion, this brush is a high quality brush without the high price tag to go with it!
  739. I use Jane Iredale products and own a few of their brushes. When I was offered this brush to review, I knew the standard that I wanted to hold it up to. A Jane Iredale brush is a fantastic product ... but price wise it is also 4X as much. Given that, you are getting a great and versatile brush with this Flat Top Kabuki that does an absolutely stellar job. I use it specifically with my JI &#34;Dream Tint&#34; which is a very light tinted moisturizer. I have used it as my foundation. The Kabuki Flat Top handles it perfectly. The brush cleans up easily and well. Feels good in the hand and has a nice weight to it.<br /><br />You cannot beat this functional brush. Look at that price! Grab it and go.
  740. Very impressive brush (flat top kabuki)! I have a few foundation brushes which are very similar (Sigma F82, Real Techniques expert face brush, Dior fluid foundation brush), all have highs and lows but this is overall the best, both quality and value performance. Pro: -Perfect density- picks up good amount of foundation, Sigma 82 & Dior are both a bit more dense, which picks up a teeny bit more product, I personally like thin layers and therefore I prefer this one better. -Fantastic bristle quality- The bristles are very fine, it applies evenly & feels soft on face, unlike the Real Techniques', which feels spiky and foundation looks streaky. The bristles of Sigma & Dior are also very fabulous, Dior feels softest on face -Perfect bristle length-Beauty junkies' bristles are longer than sigma's, I like the longer length because it allows me to apply without pulling my skin too much, Sigma is very very similar except for this part, the shorter bristles pulls my skin a bit more when buffing, especially when the brush is not just washed. -Synthetic material = no cruelty, if we can live our lives without harming others, why shouldn't we? -Low maintenance: Very easy to clean, dries quick, minimal shedding, I washed it 3x so far and just a few strands sheded around the ring. -Affordable-Great value performance 7/19/14 update: After 3 weeks of using it everyday I still love it, but it has been shedding a little more than the 1st week, I wash it every 3 days and the loosen bristles tend to come the outter ring. 7/30/14 update: After using it for more than 1 month, it shed more, there is loose hair almost every time I use it, it sheds even more when I wash it (I wash every 3-4 days), so I have to take 1 star off. 9/10/14 update: Beauty Junkee proactively asked me to contact them and they replaced the brush, very superb customer service. Will post update after I use the replacement enough to conclude.

(Maybe Beauty Junkees could look into adding a harder plastic topper on the brush.) I noticed it didn't have the rounded look after I took it from the package so I thought maybe give it a day or two and it will take shape. I just keep some DAWN dish liquid under my bathroom sink and after I put my makeup on with the brush, I put a couple of drops in the palm of my hand with warm water and clean the brush it in my hand by swirling it around and then rinsing under running warm water.   905. EDIT November 2016-ish The brush has begun to shed excessively. Disappointed :( EDIT 8/22 The handle of the brush came off completely, reminding me of the $1 ELF brushes I've used in the past. Bear in mind that I wash and dry my brushes very carefully, taking great pains to tilt it a certain way so water won't loosen the glue holding the top and handle together. I know it won't be an issue to superglue the handle back to the brush, but this occurrence was quite a disappointment. ORIGINAL REVIEW I absolutely adore this brush. When I first got it I wasn't too sure how to use it most efficiently, but after a few uses I got the hang of it. Dot your foundation/BB cream all over your face or on the brush itself, then stipple the product onto your face. First few stipples won't be perfect, but just continue to lightly stipple (not buff) and the product will blend seamlessly. It's a little difficult to get to the crevices of your face (around nose, inner eye) so I'll be trying the angled kabuki and we'll see how that goes. Overall, a really great brush and a great price. Washes well, doesn't shed. Alot of product gets stuck in the brush though, so remember to wash it thoroughly until water runs clear, or not you'll be stippling your face with old product.

  920. First of all, I'd like to say that I LOVE the fact that this brush was delivered to me on a Sunday (we don't receive mail on Sundays), so I tried it out immediately.<br />I normally use an angled kabuki flat top from ecotools, which works great, but I find that the foundation or bb creme seeps into the brush, making it difficult to clean and uses up a lot of product. I have a lot of scars that are difficult to cover up, and a lot of times end up looking too cakey because of layering, but this brush doesn't have that problem. It leaves a flawless finish with no lines, and I'm able to add layers without it looking like it's too much. I also use this brush to set my makeup with pressed powder, and it works out great!<br />The brush itself is a lot bigger than I expected, which makes my routine a lot faster. The bristles are extremely soft and not irritating to the skin at all (and I have very sensitive skin).   999. I am not a professional makeup artist. I've been a tomboy most of my life (I'm 27) and just within the last year or so I've really gotten into learning about beauty and makeup. Like most people, I watched a lot of youtube videos and most beauty gurus would recommend MAC or Sigma brushes. Unfortunately, I don't have the money to spend that much on makeup brushes. I saw the rating and reviews on this one and knew I needed a synthetic flat top Kabuki for my foundation so I took a chance on this one. I am not disappointed. This brush blends fantastically. No streaks, easy to build, and a great polished and flawless look. My old drugstore foundation brush would shed all over my face and always soaked up the product, I haven't had any of those issues with this one. Maybe in the future I'll have a little extra money to invest in professional brushes, but in the meantime this is well worth the price.

  1058. I ordered both the Flat Top and the Angled Top Kabuki Brushes by Beauty Junkees, and was pleasantly surprised to find that I truly love them. They hold their own against my beloved Sigma brushes, and that says a lot given my sensitive skin and subsequent abhorrence to anything scratchy on my face.<br /><br />First, I should note that the brushes were packaged well and had no strange odors or discolorations upon opening. The initial washing went well with no fall-out or unusual residue. The texture and shape did not change after the washing (often a problem with cheaper brushes) and there was no shedding after drying. The bristles are appreciably dense (no “plastic” feel) and the handles seem to be solid, making the brush well weighted and comfortable to use. The handles are the perfect length – 5 inches from butt to ferrule rim.<br /><br />Now for the most important part – they work exceptionally well. Most of the reviews that I had read prior to purchase raved about the effectiveness of the brushes when applying CREAM and LIQUID foundations; however, I use a mineral powder foundation (bareMinerals) and I was very concerned about how well the brushes would work for me. After 2 weeks of use, I can confirm for the powder and mineral wearer that the brushes work as well or better than the “flawless” brushes that come with our products. The bristles are synthetic so they don’t overly absorb (and waste) lots of product, yet they are soft and spread the products smoothly and evenly. Fantastic! 5 Stars!

It's excellent quality and I love not having tons of little bristles left on my face after putting on makeup. It is a bit smaller than I expected, so while it's great for foundation, it's probably even a better size for blush, contouring, etc. But regardless of what I'm using it for, everything goes on smoothly and evenly. The little package it comes in is actually resealable, which is convenient for those of you that take really good care of your brushes :) There was a faint chemical smell when I first opened it, but I'm pretty sure it was just the packaging (not the actual brush) and it went away after a few seconds.

Applying the foundation first onto my finger then dabbing it onto spots all over my face, afterwards I'd take the brush and buff the foundation out in circular motions..annnd found that it doesn't work very well in that method. I'd find minor..and I mean MINOR streaking in my foundation doing it in that method like all the other girls would with their Sigma F80 brush on youtube (which I have never owned but I could compare this very brush to that Sigma brush and I am CERTAINLY IMPRESSED)<br /><br />The BEST method in applying your liquid foundation with this brush is by dabbing your foundation onto your face with your finger then quickly taking the brush and using a stippling motion all over your face with the foundation.   1310. I have tried just about every high end makeup brush you can imagine...and can honestly say that this brush matches up to (and, in some cases, even exceeds) all of those high end, expensive brushes. I've liked it so much that I've even purchased more than one of these, so that I'm never without one while waiting for another one to dry after washing. In fact, they could justifiably charge much more for this brush if they wanted, so I'm thankful they've lowered the price point so more people on a budget can try it out! It is incredibly smooth, soft and luxurious. Yet it's also just firm enough to not require too much pressing and doesn't splay out. I used it with a stippling motion, with my liquid foundation. In the end, I got a very smooth, streak-free and airbrushed finish that really blurred my big pores (and gives moderate to full coverage). In fact, I looked so good after using this that during a dinner date, my guy actually asked if I'd done something different because I looked especially pretty! (so it's a bit of a myth that men don't notice these sorts of things...that was a nice bonus). It's also well made and doesn't shed bristles. Cleaning it was much easier than I thought, with some olive oil and a mild shampoo or soap. I was concerned it would be difficult to clean because of how dense it was, so was pleasantly surprised at how easily the makeup came out while washing. I also love that it really requires very little foundation to cover the face. Unlike many sponges and other brushes, It doesn't soak up too much of the foundation, so more of it actually ends up on your skin. This will help save money in the long run when you can use less foundation each time, so a bottle lasts longer. It was also easy enough to clean with some cleansing oil and shampoo. The only possible drawbacks I can think of is that people who want a lighter weight handle and lighter coverage may want to look elsewhere. Overall, though, you can't go wrong with this!

  1411. I ordered 3 flat top brushes and they were packaged well and arrived on time. I also own the Sigma F80 and find myself reaching for the Beauty Junkees flat top more often. I didn't experience any shedding or unevenness with the first brush I ordered, but the last two had a very significant chemical smell (gave me a headache) and did shed during the first wash and had a lot of uneven stray hairs that I had to pluck out with tweezers. I'm hoping the second two weren't a bad batch as they were gifts for my little cousins.   1414. I did not expect to love this brush. I wanted to get the Sephora one for $38, but I think that is way too expensive for a brush. I bought this one based on the price, reviews, and YouTube tutorials. Let's be honest: The instructions are never as easy as they make it look. So even though I watched the video twice, I really expected more trouble using this brush. I was so psyched with the easy, quick application and flawless coverage, I completely forgot to put on other makeup. I wanted to show off my celebrity-worthy makeup application. All you do is put a little foundation on your face, stipple it a little, and then swirl circles around your face and the brush does the rest, buffing out your foundation so you see zero lines. I was ecstatic with the application.<br /><br />On cleaning: I saw some mixed reviews on how easy it was to clean. I use Nars's new oil free foundation with this brush and that stuff dries like cement, so I've experimented cleaning my brush within 20 minutes of application and late at night--and I saw no difference in difficulty in washing the brush. I've used clarifying face wash and Ceptaphil anti-bacterial soap, and both have worked well for me. Beauty Junkees recommends using olive oil, but I don't own any, and I haven't run into any issues using my methods. I do follow the other cleaning instructions, which is to only get the bristles wet (not submerging the handle under water).<br /><br />I will recommend this brush to everyone. Also, I was incredibly impressed with the follow up from Beauty Junkees, letting me know when my order shipped and usage and cleaning instructions. For anyone thinking this brush is too good to be true, you won't be disappointed. I got rid of all my other foundation brushes, sponges, etc. This is the only brush you will ever need for flawless coverage.

  1454. I looooove this brush for my liquid foundation. When I first ordered it, I didn't realize how compacted the bristles are. I wanted a foundation brush that had the bristles a little more free-flowing at the top because my friend had a brush like that and it was great. Although these bristles are very compacted and harder to move around on my face, I found they work better this way. The quality is great, no bristles have come out whatsoever. I was always using a standard foundation brush that usually left me with bristle marks that I wouldn't notice until I went to a more lighted area. It was easy to fix, just patted a few times with my fingers, but still it got really annoying. This brush does not do that at all. In fact, it blends my foundation so nicely that my pores seem to disappear. It looks very airbrushed, which I like. It took me some time to learn proper techniques, such as, using too much foundation at once will make it look caked on. Now, I just put a little foundation on my hand and use a little bit at a time with the brush. I can always layer it if I need more coverage. The technique I first tried was using it like a paintbrush, because I was used to doing that from my other foundation brush. It did not work well. I figured out that if I first pat the brush in foundation and pat it around my face, then blend it all by doing small circles, it worked much better. I also used this brush for my bronzer powder, when I couldn't find my bronzer brush, and it looked soooo nice. This brush is amazing when it comes to blending. I highly recommend it for people using liquid foundation!

  1459. This brush is exactly what I wanted. Soft bristles, dense, and flat top. I tried it by applying my foundation. I smeared some foundation on my face here and there, then took the brush and simply buffed it in. It did a really good job of evenly spreading the foundation and it did not deposit too much in one area versus another. I got a nice, even, thin coat which is just what I wanted. If you chose to, you could even add another layer, but I just used one because otherwise, my foundation (which is actually Balm Shelter Tinted Moisturizer). tends to cake up. It lasted all day and didn't settle into any fine lines or flake at all which I've had problems with in the past. I do put moisturizer on before the Balm Shelter as I find it is too dry for my skin by itself. I've only used this brush 4 times, but each time I get the same good result. None of the bristles have come out, and it washes up beautifully with dish soap. I know you're supposed to use special brush cleaner, but I find regular foaming dish soap does a superior job of getting foundation out of the brush. I found this brush to be an excellent and fair price and a much better value than the brush I purchased at around the same price at Ulta (and consequently returned since it was prickly and did a poor job of working my foundation in). Sure, I like the brushes that come in colors and look nicer, but they are just too pricey. The head on this one is just as soft and of excellent quality as more expensive brushes I own. No one sees it but me-lol. Highly recommend.

  1484. TL;DR: Pros: FANTASTIC brush with dense bristles and amazing softness. Cons: Might have off putting smell and some initial shedding.<br />I bought this brush because youtube beauty guru Saaammage recommended their brushes (I believe she has the flat kabuki and the angled, maybe the round?) and included a coupon code. I can’t easily find real technique brushes around where I live and I only wanted a foundation brush, plus I had some Amazon credit, so why not?<br />My first impression of the brush was the chemical, paint-like smell of the packaging that brush came in which has a resealable opening which I found helpful in opening. The brush didn’t have such a strong smell, but it was still there and off putting. My brush also came with one hair that was longer than the rest and lose, so I pulled i out. The bristles were also SUPER SOFT. I was almost tempted to brush it on my face if it weren’t for the fact my face hadn’t been washed for 8 hours and the awful smell.<br />From the start, Beauty Junkees has offered fantastic customer service. My package came right on time, they sent me an email about how to apply foundation/concealer with the brush, and the packaging offers directions on cleaning. The writing also says to clean the brush before using it the first time, so I proceeded to clean with some baby shampoo because I was out of olive oil. I believe the chemical smell went away because the baby shampoo was scented.<br />I LOVE how soft and dense the brush is. When I applied bb cream and used the brush to blend it, I had a much easier time of getting an even coverage then using my fingers or my ELF foundation brush, which is what I used before. The feeling where you can’t feel individual bristles but just a dense brush blending and softly stroking your face is amazing, and I think my blending has improved so much with the brush. After I used the brush, one hair did become loose, although did not completely come off. Oh well.<br />I can’t wait to keep using this brush and hopefully it will last a long time so I don’t mind replacing it. Fantastic quality for its price. Definitely would recommend!

It was almost nearly impossible to get the brush to dry, again, because it is so dense. It is very important for me to be able to wash my brushes regularly, as I had trouble with acne and do not want to accumulate bacteria. I would recommend the Real Techniques Expert Face Brush to someone over this brush.

  1506. I use brushes for things other than makeup, so I know a well-made brush when I see one. When Beauty Junkees sent me this brush to review it, I realized that I was holding the best makeup brush I have ever owned. The thick, heavy handle, balanced and comfortable in the hand; the solid long ferrule that's better than any other brush I own, for any purpose; the wonderful soft bristles, packed densely enough to give excellent coverage and firm control... for probably the first time since high school, I couldn't wait to put on makeup and try it out.<br /><br />And there was my problem.<br /><br />I hated it at first. It wasn't floppy and sloppy like all my other makeup brushes. It did exactly what I told it to do. The problem wasn't the brush, the problem was that the brush showed me that my makeup skills were pretty poor. I usually look in the mirror and give myself a hearty \\"Eh, good enough,\\" as I walk out the door. I set the brush aside until I could learn how to use it.<br /><br />The emailed instructions from Beauty Junkees helped. Some online guides and videos helped as well. I know most people probably keep up with makeup skills, but I haven't taken the time to care for a long time so I had a lot to learn. I practiced, and went back to the lousy cheap brushes to achieve that \\"Eh, good enough to fade into the background\\" look on low self-esteem days. Then I forced myself to throw away the junk brushes and switched to this one for good.<br /><br />I'm not objective enough to know if I'm doing a good job. But yesterday a friend I haven't seen in a while said \\"Wow, you look good!\\" She studied me, trying to figure out what was different, then asked me what I'd done. My hair, clothes, and weight are all the same (drat), this brush is the only thing I've changed. I guess it's a noticeable improvement, but not painfully obvious.<br /><br />I wash this brush every day, so I hope to be able to get another one soon--on humid days it can be a little slow to dry. Since I live in a swamp a long drying time is normal for all my brushes, but this may not be the same for everyone. And someday I may even dare to buy more brushes and stretch out beyond foundation basics.<br /><br />They say good tools make all the difference. I had no idea. One well-made brush has made a very big difference here. If I could do it over again (or if I were starting from scratch right now) I'd skip the cheap junk brushes and go straight to one or two good quality brushes. I'd learn how to apply makeup well instead of how to manage with junk. And I'd save myself a lot of time and frustration.time is normal for all my brushes, but this may not be the same for everyone. And someday I may even dare to buy more brushes and stretch out beyond foundation basics. They say good tools make all the difference. I had no idea. One well-made brush has made a very big difference here. If I could do it over again (or if I were starting from scratch right now) I'd skip the cheap junk brushes and go straight to one or two good quality brushes. I'd learn how to apply makeup well instead of how to manage with junk. And I'd save myself a lot of time and frustration.

  1522. I have bought 2 of these, 1 for my liquid foundation and 1 for my mineral foundation and I am amazed by how soft and well made they are. It doesn't shed unlike other brushes that I have purchased in the past. Also, it stays soft after washings, unlike other brushes that feel rough. I have spent as much as $30 for a foundation brush and honestly, this brush is just as good as a higher priced brush. It's not made from animal hair, so the brushes aren't coarse in texture and I find that sythetic brushes do better with being washed and used over time. Plus, I feel better about buying a product that is cruelty-free.
  1523. Originally for the first month the brush is amazing. However after continuously applying my foundation the handle fell off. I tapped it back together and continued using it.   1524. I wish that the bristles were just a tiny bit longer, the bristles are so short that I can't get a good buffing motion- there is too little give in the brush head, I find it requires me to hold it parallel to the floor- you can't have any angle at all or it simply doesn't make contact with your skin- it requires a very unnatural and uncomfortable arm/wrist posture. If you are comfortable with a bristle this short it's a nice quality brush- no shedding, soft, appears well made; but I wouldn't purchase again, I would get something with slightly longer bristles that would glide and give a better buffing motion and more comfortable to use.
  1525. When i first recieved this brush back in August, i loved it. The foundation, powder and concelaer brush were my first makeup brushes and i used them everyday faithfully. After just two months of owning the foundation brush, the bristles started coming out in strands then clumps, until one day the entire brush had pulled away from the handle. I had to throw the whole thing in the trash. It is best to invest in something of better quality if you are going for long term use.

  1542. UPDATE 1/25/16: For the past few months this brush has been SHEDDING LIKE MAD!! I was a bit afraid of this because of the cheap glue smell when first receiving the product. I own many different brands of brushes from low-end (EcoTools, Elf) to high-end (MAC, Christian Dior) and in between (Real Techniques) and have never had a brush shed on me before. The shedding is most annoying when trying to apply foundation and having to take the time and remove separated bristles from under my foundation. Will not purchase from this brand again. ORIGINAL REVIEW: This review is for the Flat Top Kabuki brush. I have used this brush a few times for applying my liquid foundation and am very impressed with the way it applies foundation to my face. Previously, I was using the Real Techniques stippling brush and was quite pleased with the results but once I used this Beauty Junkees, the difference was noticeable. The foundation seemed even more airbrushed, even, and more natural. The bristles are extraordinarily soft and it is a pleasure to use on my face. I have never used a brush this large for applying foundation so am still getting used to going around my eyes and nose with it (I find it a bit awkward around tight areas--but certainly can not reduce my rating because of my own preferences in brush shapes.) The only real negative I have about the brush so far is the awful and extremely potent/toxic glue smell that permeated both the inside of the package and on the brush itself when first opening it. The smell was so strong I feared the glue for the bristles was not sufficiently cured. Fortunately, the smell disappeared after washing the brush thoroughly with baby shampoo but now I am a bit wary about the bristles falling out with repeated washing , especially after having to wash it so frequently because of its use with liquid foundations that needs to be removed often. Hopefully, this is not the case but I did deduct a star for this horrible smell. But, other than the smell, really am liking it so far.
  1543. It smells something like medicine when you first open it, but after washing it goes away. This brush makes my foundation go on so evenly and smoothly giving an airbrushed effect. Usually I use a stippling brush for a smooth look but the application sometimes hurts my skin. This brush however is so soft and gives the same effect if not better. Love this brush!!
  1544. So glad I bought this brush. I bought a MAC foundation brush and it smeared make up on my face leaving streaks. ukh! then I bought this one and wow! all of a sudden I felt like I had a suede finish on my face (I used the same foundation in both of the applications). What a great brush!
